title: Blenheim Palace
summary: Blenheim Palace (pronounced /ˈblɛnɪm/ BLEN-im[1]) is a  country house in Woodstock, Oxfordshire, England.  It is the seat of the Dukes of Marlborough and the only non-royal, non-episcopal country house in England to hold the title of palace.  The palace, one of England's largest houses, was built between 1705 and 1722, and designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987.[2]
